_header: Saint Chad the good man was born of England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Chad, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Chad in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Chadde þe holi mon was of engelondeBiscop he was of
                    lichesfeld as ic vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& wiþ angles to heuene wende as hi broȝte him er
                    tydyngeNou god uor þe loue of him to þulke Ioie ous
                    bringe

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Chadde þe gode Mon was her of EngelondeBisschop he was
                    of Licheffelde as vr lord him ȝaf his sonde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…With angels to þe ioye of heuene as heo him er brouȝte
                    tiþingeNou God for þe loue of Seint Chadde to þilke ioye vs
                    bringe. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Chadde þe godeman was of EngelondeBisshop he was of
                    lychefeld as I vnderstonde…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…With angles to heuen he wend As þei him brouȝte we
                    tiþingNou god for þe loue of hym To þat ioye vs
                    bringe
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Chadde þe goode man was of IngelondBischop he was of
                    lichefelde as I vndirstond…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…And wiþ aungellis to heuene wente as þei brouȝte er
                    tidingGod for þe loue of him to þat ioye vs all
                    bringe

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint chadde þe gode man was here of engelondebissop he was
                    of lycheffeld as ich vnderstonde…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…& wiþ angles to heuene as hy broȝte er
                    tyþingeNow god for þe loue of him to þulke ioie vs
                    bringe
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein chadde þe godeman was of engelondeBissop he was of
                    lettesfeld as ich vnderstonde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…& wiþ angles to heuene wende as he broȝte her
                    tiþingeNou god for þe lous of him to þulke ioye us
                    bringe

D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.

                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS

CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:

                    lichefeld as ic vnderstonde…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& with angles to heuene wende as hii broȝt er

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
SEynt chadde þe godeman was of engelondebissop he was of
                    leccesfeld as y vnder stonde…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…And wiþ angles to heuene wende as hy broȝte er
                    tyþingeNou god for þe loue of him to þat Ioye vs
                    bringe

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEyn chadde þe godeman was of englondbischop he was of lecheffeld as ich vnþerstonde…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& with angeles to heuen wente as hi broȝte him ertidingnou god for þe loue of him to þilke ioie ous bringe
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xix” added to left margin by later hand (f. 33v).

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEint chadde þe godeman was of engelondeByssop he was of lecchesfeld as ich vnder stonde…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …And wiþ angles to heuene wende as hi broȝte her tiþingeNou god for þe loue of hym to þulke ioie us bringe

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Chadde þe holy mon was here of EnglondBisshop he was of
                    lichfeld as ȝe shul vnderstonde…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…With angels to þe ioye of heuen as him come ere
                    tiþingeAnd Ihesu for saynt Chaddes love to þat ioye vs bringe
                    Amen
